name: South x Southwest
description: When Josh Pearson of Sepia in Chicago first created this tequila-based drink, it was intended to be served with Australian sparkling wine (south by southwest, get it?). But when supplies of the stuff became unreliable, Sepia switched to Moscato d'Asti as the topper for this ongoing crowd favorite.
recipeIngredient: 1 ounce freshly squeezed juice from 1 lemon

recipeInstructions.text: Muddle rosemary in a cocktail shaker. Add tequila, St. Germain, lemon, and bitters to cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Top with Moscato d'Asti and garnish with a sprig of rosemary.
